title: What Sri Lankans Can Watch This Weekend in Sport
byline: Sri Lankan sports fans have a busy few days ahead, with Premier League football spread across the weekend and important cricket matches reaching key stages, including the Under-19 Asia Cup final in Dubai and ongoing Test series in Australia and New Zealand.

title: India beats Sri Lanka by eight wickets, sets up final against Pakistan
byline: Vihaan Malhotra and Aaron George starred, smashing unbeaten fifties in the chase as India chased down a 139-run target in the semifinal.

title: Samba, Keeri Samba shortage likely: Minister
byline: There could be a shortage in Samba and Keeri Samba rice in the country due to the devastation caused to paddy cultivation by the Ditwah cyclone, Trade, Commerce, Food Security and Cooperative Development Minister Wasantha Samarasinghe said yesterday.

title: Ashoka Ranwala’s driving license temporarily suspended
byline: Mahara Magistrate Bandara Ilangasinghe yesterday (19) ordered the temporary suspension of the driving license of former Speaker and Gampaha District Parliamentarian Ashoka Ranwala following the accident in Sapugaskanda.

title: US carries out ’massive’ strike against IS in Syria
byline: The US says its military has carried out a ’’massive strike’’ against the Islamic State group (IS) in Syria, in response to a deadly attack on American forces in the country.

title: At least two years needed to rebuild Ditwah-Hit nation
byline: Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya told Parliament yesterday that the full rebuilding of the nation battered by Cyclone Ditwah would take at least two years, citing ongoing landslide risks and the need to relocate populations and schools in several areas.

title: Local malware incidents top Rs.3.9mn in 3Q as offline threats persist: Kaspersky
byline: Sri Lanka recorded over 3.9 million local malware incidents in the third quarter of 2025 alone, with nearly a quarter of users encountering offline threats, new data from global cybersecurity firm Kaspersky reveals.

title: Paul goes to hospital with suspected broken jaw
byline: Jake Paul has gone to hospital with a suspected broken jaw after he was stopped by Anthony Joshua in their heavyweight fight in Miami.

title: Sri Lanka gets US$50 Mn World Bank boost for digital transformation
byline: The World Bank Board of Executive Directors has approved a US$50 million project to support Sri Lanka’s digital transformation.

title: Police raid alleged brothel operating as spa in Colombo
byline: Police on Friday night raided a premises allegedly operating as a brothel under the guise of a spa in Colombo and arrested one suspect and nine foreign women, police said.

title: Recent disaster is a result of nature’s fury against unwarranted human activities: Vedda Chief
byline: Vedda Chief Uruwarige Vannila Ettho said the ill-planned development projects and the human activities resulted in the recent natural disaster that caused much woe and sorrow in the country.
